alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:05PM EDT until May 03 at 9:38AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Franklin and Somerset Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Carrabassett River...including North Anson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...From Monday morning to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35,000.0 cfs, Flooding begins at campgrounds in Skowhegan. At 60,000.0 cfs, East River Road starts to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Sunday the flow was 9,323.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to 65,590.0 cfs tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 34,570.0 cfs. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
